Matt Murdock.Action: Donning the Daredevil costume and operating in the real world without superpowers but relying on skill and determination.
Bleeding to death and collapsing in a church, showing physical vulnerability and possible failure in the immediate situation.
Pries a beer bottle from his father's fingers and helps him to his feet.
Dismisses his own injury to avoid worrying his father (cut lip, says 'Nothin').
Pulls a beer bottle from his passed-out father's hand and helps him to his feet, showing calmness and responsibility despite his own injury.
Understands and correctly reports the boxing match outcome to his father, demonstrating awareness and clarity.
Tries to walk away from fighting as advised, showing self-control and good judgment.
Admits he ‘gets beat up’ instead of fighting back, suggesting a lack of confidence or skill in physical confrontation at this moment.
Smiles relieved after his father defends him, showing trust and a warm connection.
Promises his father to keep hitting the books and do well, demonstrating sincerity and respect.
Searches for his father at the docks despite knowing it's dangerous, showing concern and care.
Freezes and shows emotional reaction to hearing his father’s voice in danger, indicating empathy and attachment.
Turns and runs off down the alley crying when confronted with his father, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Holds his father in his arms, comforting him as the father breaks down in guilt, showing empathy and tenderness.
Reassures his father by saying 'I’m not afraid' despite his blindness, demonstrating acceptance and perhaps a reassuring sincerity.
Silently asks for quiet and shares his heightened perception of sound with his father, indicating openness and a willingness to connect.
Turns and runs off down the alley, blinded by tears after seeing his father, showing an emotional reaction rather than measured control.
Listens attentively and demonstrates awareness by knowing he is blind and sensing conversations in the doctor's office despite not seeing, showing intellectual and sensory attunement.
Calmly tells his father he hears everything and is not afraid despite his blindness, showing confidence and acceptance of his condition.
Holds his father and comforts him even while blind and emotionally vulnerable, demonstrating emotional maturity and capacity to support others.
Comforts a bigger fighter while holding him in his arms, showing empathy and support.
Perseveres through the painful process of learning braille, demonstrating patience and personal resilience but no explicit warmth.
Falls and curses after stepping in front of a taxi, reflecting frustration and vulnerability but not necessarily warmth.
Allows the harsh, painful sounds to enter and uses anger productively against the speed bag, showing acceptance and self-regulation without direct social warmth.
Whips out his cane to stop an old man from stepping into traffic and getting hit by a bus.
Smiles warmly after performing athletic feats on the rooftop, responding to imagined cheers.
Whips out his cane just in time to stop an old man from stepping into danger, preventing a bus accident.
Performs complex gymnastic maneuvers on rooftops confidently, demonstrating physical skill and spatial awareness despite blindness.
Calls out encouragingly to his father during the fight, showing care and support.
Rushes to his father's side after hearing violence, holds his lifeless body and sobs, showing deep sorrow and love.
Uses his hyperacute hearing to detect violence nearby, attempts to find and help his father.
Unable to prevent his father's murder despite his senses and proximity.
Shows emotional breakdown and sobbing, struggling to cope with trauma.
Addresses the jury sincerely about seeking truth and justice for the victim without monetary gain.
Addresses the courtroom with confidence and persuasive speech seeking justice.

Restrains himself from physically attacking Quesada despite anger at his cruelty.
Expresses deep concern for the victim's suffering and questions societal judgment against her.
Rejects idea of drinking to numb pain, choosing to focus on work despite frustration.
Smiles as he falls ten stories street below, showing fearless attitude despite his blindness.

Transforms his cane into a versatile weapon (the billy club) with skill.
Performs daring acrobatic feats such as leaping across rooftops and safely plunging ten stories to the street, guided by his senses.
Confidently uses specialized gear (high-impact boots, wire-mesh gloves) optimized for his abilities.
Smiles as he falls from a great height, showing fearless confidence.
Confronts armed mobsters in a bar despite danger, tries to get them to admit guilt before fighting.

Uses extraordinary senses and precision to disarm and neutralize threats quickly, but in a harsh and brutal manner.
Unintentionally causes harm to several bystanders (bikers and skinheads) in the course of fighting.
Uses a hybrid fighting style combining martial arts and street fighting, effectively taking on multiple opponents with brutal kicks, punches, and elbows.
Utilizes his extraordinary senses to maintain situational awareness in a chaotic, strobe-lit, smoky melee, showing skill and intelligence.

Uses his billy club as a tool to run along the wall while bullets fire hundreds of rounds at him, skillfully evading harm.

Confronts and threatens Quesada for raping a girl in Hell's Kitchen, asserting his role as protector of his neighborhood.
Acts as a relentless avenger with a 'madman' demeanor showing intense anger and willingness to use violence.
Uses his hyperacute senses to track and confront a dangerous criminal with determination and precision.

Recovers quickly from sensory overload and successfully disarms and incapacitates his attacker with a precise strike.
Lashes out precisely to break Quesada's leg, displaying skill and timing in combat.
Uses billy club to hook the end railing of the train and propel himself down the tunnel, demonstrating resourcefulness and confident physical control.

Keeps his apartment spare and impersonal, with no personal photos or decorations visible.

Treats his wounds quietly and alone, showing self-care but also isolation.

Withdraws into isolation to cope with stress and pain, closing sensory inputs to gain calm, indicating intelligent self-regulation.
